intro: Boechera sanluisensis, commonly known as the San Luis Mountains rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in the San Luis Valley of Colorado. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its stems are usually unbranched, with small, linear leaves along their length. Boechera sanluisensis is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
